ajmc.ocr package#

ajmc.ocr is a package for optical character recognition (OCR) of historical documents. It is very work-in-progress and is not meant to be used as a library yet. Methods, classes and functions are subject to change at any time and are mainly implemented around experiments (notably in ocr.pytorch and ocr.tesseract).

Submodules#

ajmc.ocr.config module#

This module handles reading of configs from tsv-files.

Note

Configs are stored in central tsv files rather than json for easier comparability.

ajmc.ocr.config.config_to_tesstrain_config(config)[source]#

Transforms a config to a tesstrain config which will be added to the training command.

Note

See https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesstrain for all possible parameters.

ajmc.ocr.evaluation module#

ocr/evaluation performs a double evaluation of ocr outputs against given groundtruth data.

  1. Bag-of-word evaluation: computes errors by matching words which have the minimal edit distance in a bag of groundtruth and in a a bag of predicted word.

  2. Coordinate based evaluation: computes errors by matching words with overlapping coordinates.

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.bag_of_word_evaluation(gt_bag: List[str], pred_bag: List[str], error_counts: Dict[str, int | float] | None = None) → Dict[str, int | float][source]#

Performs a bag-of-word evaluation of pred_bag against groundtruth_bag.

Parameters:

  • gt_bag The list of groundtruth words

  • pred_bag The list of ocr-predicted words

  • error_counts A dict with results (pass it if you want to evaluate multiple pages)

Returns:

Error statistics (dict)

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.commentary_evaluation(commentary: OcrCommentary, write_files: bool = True, output_dir: str | None = None, word_overlap_threshold: float = 0.8)[source]#

Evaluates all the pages of a OcrCommentary that have groundtruth.

Parameters:

  • commentary The OcrCommentary object to evaluate.

  • write_files Whether to write the files or not

  • output_dir Leave to none if you want to write files to the default dir

  • word_overlap_threshold See coord_based_page_evaluation.

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.coord_based_page_evaluation(gt_page: OcrPage, pred_page: OcrPage, word_overlap_threshold: float | None = 0.8, error_counts: Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, int]]] | None = None, editops_record: Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], int] | None = None) → Tuple[dict, dict, BeautifulSoup][source]#

Performs a regional and coordinates-based evaluation.

This function returns extremely detailed counts, with word counts, caracter counts by charsets (latin, greek, numbers and punctuation) and correct rate (cr, corresponding to the normalized levenshtein distance) for each of these elements and for each olr region (commentary, primary text).

How to read the results? cr or ccr / cwr (correct character/word rate respectively) very straightforward. They correspond to the number of correct elements divided by the total number of elements.

Note

Coordinate-based means that evaluation does not process documents in a linear manner, which is prone to alignement error when document layouts are complex. Instead, this matches overlapping words in groundtruth and ocr-data. More formally, for each groundtruth word : * find the predicted word which coordinates overlap the with groundtruth word to word_overlap_threshold * if found, calculate Levenshtein distance between the two * if not found, do not evaluate this word

Parameters:

  • gt_page The groundtruth page

  • pred_page The predicted page

  • word_overlap_threshold The threshold to find overlaping words

  • error_counts A dict of counts (pass in if you want to evaluate multiple pages at once)

  • editops_record A dict of edit operations (pass in if you want to evaluate multiple pages at once)

Returns:

error_counts, editops_record, soup

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.count_errors_by_charset(gt_string: str, pred_string: str, charset: str) → int[source]#

Counts the number of errors among the character comprised in an unicode character set.

Example

count_errors_by_charset('Hll_ World1', '- world', 'greek') returns 3 as among the 4 greek chars in gt, 3 are misrecognized.

Parameters:

  • pred_string prediction/source string

  • gt_string groundtruth/destination string

  • charset should be 'greek', 'latin', 'numbers', 'punctuation' or a valid re-pattern, for instance r'([-])'

Returns:

the number of errors on selected caracters in pred_string

Return type:

int

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.directory_evaluation(gt_dir: Path, ocr_dir: Path, gt_suffix: str = '.txt', ocr_suffix: str = '.txt', error_record: dict = None, editops_record: dict = None, output_dir: Path | None = None, normalize: bool = True) → Tuple[dict, dict, dict][source]#

Evaluates all the text files in ocr_dir against the corresponding text files in gt_dir.

Parameters:

  • gt_dir The directory containing the groundtruth files.

  • ocr_dir The directory containing the OCR files.

  • gt_suffix The suffix of the groundtruth files.

  • ocr_suffix The suffix of the OCR files.

  • error_record The error record to update (pass only if you want to aggregate multiple evaluations).

  • editops_record The editops record to update (pass only if you want to aggregate multiple evaluations).

  • output_dir If given, the evaluation files will be written to this directory.

  • normalize Whether to harmonise the unicode of the groundtruth and OCR files.

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.initialize_soup(img_width: int, img_height: int) → BeautifulSoup[source]#

Initializes a blank html page for comparing predictions and errors

Parameters:

  • img_width Width of the pages image.

  • img_height Height of the pages image

Returns:

The initialized BeautifulSoup Object

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.insert_text_in_soup(soup: BeautifulSoup, word: OcrWord, is_gt: bool, is_false: bool) → BeautifulSoup[source]#

Adds content to soup object.

This function is used to add single words to the soup object initialized by initialize_soup, thereby reconstructing both the groundtruth and the preds page, with false words in red.

Parameters:

  • soup an initilised BeautifulSoup object

  • word The ocr- or groundtruth word to add

  • is_gt Wheter the word is groundtruth or not (determines where to place it).

  • is_false Whether the word was falsely predicted or not.

Returns

The modified BeautifulSoup object

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.line_based_evaluation(gt_lines: List[str], ocr_lines: List[str], error_record: dict = None, editops_record: dict = None, output_dir: Path | None = None, normalize: bool = True) → Tuple[dict, dict, dict][source]#

Evaluates all the text files in ocr_dir against the corresponding text files in gt_dir.

Parameters:

  • gt_lines The list of groundtruth lines.

  • ocr_lines The list of OCR lines.

  • error_record The error record to update (pass only if you want to aggregate multiple evaluations).

  • editops_record The editops record to update (pass only if you want to aggregate multiple evaluations).

  • output_dir If given, the evaluation files will be written to this directory.

  • normalize Whether to harmonise the unicode of the groundtruth and OCR files.

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.record_editops(gt_word: str, ocr_word: str, editops: list, editops_record: Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], int]) → Dict[Tuple[str, str, str], int][source]#

Adds word-level edit operation to the record of all edit operations

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.simple_coordinates_based_evaluation(gt_words: List[CanonicalWord | OcrWord], pred_words: List[CanonicalWord | OcrWord], overlap_threshold: float = 0.8) → float[source]#

Computes edit distance between spacially overlapping words and returns the CER.

Simple means that this method does NOT deal with word-boxes related issues. It only evaluates gt-words which overlap to overlap_threshold with a predicted word and vice-versa. If no predicted word is found (e.g. with crummy groundtruth- or preds-boxes), the word is left out and not counted in the final result.

Parameters:

  • gt_words The list of ground truth words (e.g. coming from OcrPage.children.words)

  • pred_words The list of predicted words (e.g. coming from OcrPage.children.words)

  • overlap_threshold The minimal overlap-proportion.

Returns:

the character error rate

Return type:

float

ajmc.ocr.evaluation.write_editops_record(editops_record: dict, output_dir: Path)[source]#
ajmc.ocr.evaluation.write_error_counts(bow_error_counts: dict, coord_error_counts: dict, output_dir: str)[source]#

ajmc.ocr.utils module#

A bunch of ocr tools.

ajmc.ocr.utils.get_kraken_command(commentary_id: str, model_path: str | Path) → str[source]#

LEGACY. Returns the command to be executed by Kraken.

Parameters:

  • commentary_id The id of the commentary (e.g. sophoclesplaysa05campgoog). Ids are listed in ajmc.commons.variables.ALL_COMM_IDS.

  • model_path the path to the model to be used.

ajmc.ocr.utils.guess_ocr_format(ocr_path: Path) → str[source]#

Guesses the ocr-format of a file.

Parameters:

ocr_path The absolute path to an ocr output file.

Returns:

The ocr-format of the file, either pagexml, krakenhocr or tesshocr.
